form.name: exclusive_breastfeeding_when_mother_is_taking_arvs
form.page_subtitle: PNC Counselling: Infant Feeding> Exclusive Breastfeeding When Mother is Taking ARVs

field.name: Exclusively breastfeeding (giving only breast milk) for the first 6 months together with ARVs for either yourself and your baby will greatly help reduce chances of HIV passing from yourself to your baby
By only giving breast milk, your baby also receives all the benefits of breastfeeding including protection from diarrhoea and other illnesses
It is very important to avoid mixed feeding. Mixed feeding means feeding your baby both breast milk and any other foods or liquids, including infant formula, animal milks, or water
Take your baby to ART centre to be tested for HIV when he/she is 6 weeks old
